website_summaries.verdict: Its high quality and durability, along with a slew of features and extras, draw a lot of praise for this mid-price, mid tower case.
pros: Available in several different colors and color combinations
Full-metal body, with a tempered glass side panel
Features a removable HDD cage, 10-color RGB downlight and power strip, and two 120-millimeter fans
cons: Some buyers report that this case arrives damaged, missing parts, or in the wrong color
USB ports may not be very durable

customer_reviews.title: The build quality is nice, styling is sleek
customer_reviews.text: I really can't believe they only charge $80 for this case. The build quality is nice, styling is sleek, and touching the buttons leaves you feeling like you're dealing with a really high quality product. I've already suggested the case to a few friends. The RGB strip that comes with the case is long enough to run across the front or rear. if you want more lighting I would advise ordering the 1M Phanteks RGB strip upgrade. The 2M strip would be far too long for this smaller case. The 1M strip is long enough to go around 3 edges. I ran my 1M through 3 edges, and then put the strip that came with the case behind my radiator.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie H.

customer_reviews.title: Great looking case but missing accessories, hardware and manual
customer_reviews.text: I was eagerly waiting for the case to arrive and for my disappointment it did not come with any of the accessories or screws or even manuals. This looks like a returned part which is missing all the parts and has risers already installed in the case. I can't believe phanteks doesn't even look for the parts it is sending to the customer. I called amazon customer service and they requested manufacturer to send the replacement screws for me. I can't work on my project because of this. However case looks amazing in white and no complaints about the style and case itself.
customer_reviews.author: Sri Adusumilli

customer_reviews.title: One small gripe...
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great, feature-rich case for the price. My main complaint is the poor documentation for the RGB controller....its a SATA style power connector . The manual shows 'all' connections except for that one. A friend put my rig together but left that cable in the midst of a rats nest in the back and I was beginning to think I had a case with a faulty panel board.....found it and plugged it in and voila. Aside from that, very happy with this case. Looks great, not too flashy with room for extra upgrades in the future. I would recommend this case for the price point (got mine on sale for 69),
customer_reviews.author: Ryan W

customer_reviews.title: Not enough room
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in November of 2017, and since then I've had the side panels off installing a new power supply, new SSD, and other things. The main problem is that the power supply basement is way too small. There's two available HDD spots in the basement which cut in to cable routing. Trying to fit a Corsair RM750x in the thing was a nightmare, and it gets worse every time I need to plug in more power cables. If the whole case was an inch or two longer or taller, to allow the basement to be more roomy this would be a much better case. Don't think I'll be buying Phanteks mid tower, again.
customer_reviews.author: Kami Amaya

customer_reviews.title: Great case but some minor issues
customer_reviews.text: The case is great but for me, the LEDs had to be plugged into the mobo because all 4 of my sata plugs from the psu are powering my ssds and hdds so there was not a spare for me to plug it into. Plugging the led into the mobo results in very dim red lights that I cant change. Due to not having an extra sata plug available the downlight also does not work. So make sure you have 1 available. Beyond me not knowing i would need a sata plug from the psu to power the lights, its a good quality case with nice quality and easy to build in with all the space.
customer_reviews.author: Omar P.

customer_reviews.title: Nice look, terrible airflow
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice if the style is for you. Decent build quality/materials. Somewhat outdated design by 2019 standards. Terrible airflow!!! Front panel is super restrictive, only two small intakes at top and bottom of panel with very tight dust filters. Temps on GPU drop up to 10C with panel off versus on with 2x 140mm front and 1x 120mm rear exhaust. Proprietary rgb connectors is just dumb, it's bad and Phanteks should feel bad about that. Would I recommend it? NO. There are better options for the same/less money, some of them even made by Phanteks, there's a reason this has been replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Popevader

customer_reviews.title: Case looks great. Sort of wish I'd spent the extra $27 ...
customer_reviews.text: This was my first PC build in a while. Everything fit cleanly into this case with no problems. Cable management was a breeze. Case looks great. Sort of wish I'd spent the extra $27 for the S model. Not sure I appreciate the tempered glass siding. Just seems like something that's going to get broken in time. Still don't understand how to control the lighting. Pressing the button changes color, but not sure how to adjust the pattern. Maybe someone can comment. I appreciate that the lighting was a magnetic strip as I'm not sure I'll leave it there in the long term.
customer_reviews.author: J. Blattman

customer_reviews.title: Terrible airflow
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very beautiful, sleek and sexy, well built with lots of options for cable management, drive mounts, and water cooling rads. Cons: Airflow. This is hands down the worst case in terms of airflow I ever had. While the temperatures were fine, this case made my fans scream in agony. Rather than idling at low rpm's, the fans had to constantly run on high in order to keep temperatures at acceptable levels even when idling (30-40C for CPU & GPU).
customer_reviews.author: Godrik

customer_reviews.title: Great visuals, horrible acoustics
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice case. Looks great. Easy to build inside. Has a cool LED strip included. It is VERY noisy. Coming from a Fractal Design C with noise suppression, this Phanteks case does absolutely nothing to reduce fan noise. My GTX1080TI and Corsair H110 sound like jet engines. I'll probably roll with it for a while then get something else.
customer_reviews.author: T. Yanez

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid case for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have always used cheap cases for my computer builds in the past. This time I wanted something a little nicer, and boy, a few extra bucks goes a long way. Super roomy with nicely pre-placed standoffs. The included fans are pretty quiet as well. I am not big into flashy colored builds, but this one has some nice accents that make it like a night light for my computer room. I am tempted to buy another to put my old setup in as well!
customer_reviews.author: J. Schaule

customer_reviews.title: Didn't come with any accessories!!! And doesnt fit my motherboard!!
customer_reviews.text: It literally just shipped with the case. No accessory box included at all, and I'm assembling on a weekend right before I go on a trip so I have no idea what I'm going to do with all my parts just sitting out. Ridiculous that I'm going to have to spend the time returning this as well. Would give 0 stars if I could. How could you forget to include the accessories? Never buying Phanteks again
customer_reviews.author: Brian Cutler

customer_reviews.title: 8 Stitches
customer_reviews.text: My family was evacuating for a hurricane and had to carry out the computer, usually not an issue. We lift it from the bottom BUT there's a ventilation screen that doesn't attach, it slides out. The case/screen slipped out and all landed on my hand. Mid-evacuation we had to go to the ER and get 8 stitches. I have NO IDEA why the ventilation screen on the bottom SLIDES OUT right where you would pick it up rather than slide in and attach with a latch or any way of locking it in place. Especially at the bottom where people would lift it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great case for all. First time builders or new rig builders included.
customer_reviews.text: Great mid size case and phenomenal first time builder case. I'm the first timer. Gots room for good cable management (comes with zip ties as well so you don't need any of your own), great airflow (intake fan inlets have an inch of space so air starvation is not a problem). Even the Noctua NH-D15 fits, RAMs the only thing limiting it then (120mm fan is a great alternative if RAM size permits). Has 2 RGB lights (a magnetic strip for the interior of the case and a bottom front light with color and lighting type options you can control.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Hulcy

customer_reviews.title: Poor air flow
customer_reviews.text: I built my first pc and I liked my old prebuilt phantex p350x so I tried this case, it's a nice case but the space for cable managment in the back is a bit tight, the front cover is the true downfall of the case since it's only vented top and bottom, I'll probably cut the face out and add a screen
customer_reviews.author: Kurt N.

customer_reviews.title: Pleasure to build in
customer_reviews.text: First nice case that I have bought, but it's been amazing to work with. Fits full-sized GPUs and a rad up front with a push pull configuration. Only complaint is that the screws to hold on the back panel are at a very extream angle as if the holes were drilled wrong or the guy on the final assembly line did not give a crap and forced the thumb screws in with a power tool. Since I'm hardly ever taking off the back plate, I don't mind too much. 1 star taken away for that.
customer_reviews.author: rit

customer_reviews.title: Great case at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic case. Well built, intelligent design, beautiful, and the included LED strip that doesn't need to be hooked up to e.g. Aurasync is a nice touch. Very spacious and there are removable dust covers EVERYWHERE. My only issue is the two thumbscrews to remove the back access panel were horribly crunchy and overtightened, and both of them seemed to be crossthreaded by default. Not too much of an issue to lower the rating however. The two fans it came with I had planned to remove and use noctuas in, but they're actually very decent and quiet, so I kept them in.
customer_reviews.author: Vexxel

customer_reviews.title: Best case for the money
customer_reviews.text: This case has a great value for the price! It has exceptional cable management in the back that already has ties attached, and a power supply shroud that helps you hide your cables as well. It has two 2.5" SSD spots and two standard HDD slots. 240MM radiator is pictured. It also comes with 2 LED strips! One is permanently attached at the bottom, and the other comes in a separate bag that is magnetic. I attached it at the top and it looks pretty great! It has a light button on the front that allows you to change the colors but there is no separate rgb controller.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mann

customer_reviews.title: Nice case
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of room for ATX motherboard, RGB lighting is not overwhelming, plenty of space behind the motherboard backplate and side panel to run cables, velcro straps to hold cables, buttons on the front to somewhat control the RGB lighting, and the panels have sound dampening material. The top of the case can be removed to help with installation of components.
customer_reviews.author: Panhead

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Love this case. One of the best out there in my opinion. Fully customizable with a tempered glass window. 2 rgb strips included. some of the wires are pre-routed. Cant give 5 stars because of two things: 4 of the screws in the case were strippped on arrival. It took a lot of work to take these screws out and replace them with others, and the box with all of the case parts,screws and directions were deep inside the case that required some thinking to find and access. Some instructions on where to find the box could alleviate this issue. Overall, i had no major issues when building in this case. Build looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: dhrose20

customer_reviews.title: Above and Beyond Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case for my first ever gaming PC build, and WOW. The cable management was super easy and everything is nicely hidden away. The tempered glass side panel lets you appreciate it, too! I can definitely recommend putting the magnetic LED strip at the top of the case as others have recommended - it looks very nice and you can't see the strip itself. I'll also add that the buttons/ports on the front are very nice, as well as everything about the back - easy graphics card & motherboard backplate installation.
customer_reviews.author: bjzee

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Case!
customer_reviews.text: I love this case. It is sleek and has great colors. The power button has an awesome outline led and I am a big fan of orange and normally the automatic color for orange is very yellow and I always hate products with pre-built colors. There are also two SSD slots hidden on the non glass side of the case and I love how hidden it is. The glass is sturdy and there is plenty of room inside the case and the design allows for cord management to be a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This case looks amazing. Very easy to set up with lots of great features like the back mounted SSD's and the built in cable straps. Sleek looking and the RGB is super easy to set up as its a magnetic strip, no need to fuss with that double sided tape. Also allows you to move it around whenever you'd like which is nice.has plenty of places to run wires. Wish there was a better way to hide the front case fan wires but that's my only real complaint. Otherwise VERY sharp looking case.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Pegoli

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: I got tired on my antec 900, it was just too big. I ended up doing two case swaps using this Phantek and another just like it in white for my brothers pc. I have 1 more PC i need to case swap, i will probably be getting another one of these... or at least another mid tower from Phantek.
customer_reviews.author: I am quite picky

customer_reviews.title: Nice case, quality feel, look
customer_reviews.text: Better quality, feel, look than the cheaper Silverstone case I sent back. Would like a little more space behind in cable area if I had to nitpick, but minor, would purchase again. Large case, I am using braided power cable extenders for look, not sure if regular power supply cable length would have worked.
customer_reviews.author: rsr72

customer_reviews.title: Great case, and absolutely nothing to complain about
customer_reviews.text: Great case, and absolutely nothing to complain about. The removal of the drive rack gives you infinite amounts of room, it is wonderful! You folks trying to do RGB synced case lighting: you have to buy the Phanteks RGB LED 4 Pin Adapter to plug the included light strip into your motherboard header! Would be nice if it came with that included, but it's a good price for tempered glass RGB, so no complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, feels cheap. Bad threads for case screws. DO NOT BUY FOR OVER 80$
customer_reviews.text: I was fairly disappointed by the overall quality immediately upon receiving. Just feels like a cheap Chinese case. I like that it has all the neat features for cable management. Panels looked awkward and rippled at the curves. The case screws that hold on the metal panel are garbage. One is already stripped. The glass panel has no lip to grab onto, so when your putting it back on it always slams into the rest of the case. Overall, not impressed at all.
customer_reviews.author: RVM

customer_reviews.title: I chose the Black on Black for 68 bucks shipped and absolutely love it. Pretty good case actually
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, this is a 5 star review but the price is weird. 10 bucks for 1x6 inches of color difference? Dont be fooled, the colors can be changed so dont think you have the purchase the picture with the lighting you want. I chose the Black on Black for 68 bucks shipped and absolutely love it. Pretty good case actually, one of the better ones Ive ordered in recent memory. If you have a full ATX motherboard run your wires prior to screwing it in though as the holes can be cut off once the motherboard is in place.
customer_reviews.author: Nevada

customer_reviews.title: As much a a love the case there is few things that a did ...
customer_reviews.text: As much a a love the case there is few things that a did not like about the side panel the screws are all striped and it's very hard to close the case it looks like it was bent when it was put together and they never bother with replacing the screws or the panel for that matter. Other then the side panel is a great case this is my second build and am happy with the nice glass the led the red glow logo the cable management is top notch. A will be posting pictures but a really like the case besides the side panel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the case but not for use with aircooling Threadripper
customer_reviews.text: Intended to use the case in a threadripper build but there isn’t enough clearance for the noctua TR4 cooler. Had I gone AIO or custom water it’d be fine. Instead it now has a Ryzen 1700 with AIO and looks amazing. Very nice build experience and fits a 280mm rad if you remove the top panel for the PSU shroud. I don’t think an AIO would fit on top so expect to front mount
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: It's worth the money. Colorful, too!
customer_reviews.text: Taking the item out of its double boxed, plastic bag and styrofoam protection, the case and glass itself is stunning. It gives you everything to build a stunning system. Easy to use hard drive brackets for sliding the drives in and out, screws and more screws, and a included RGB magnetic strip to add to the system. It is all controlled by a discreet button at the top, providing lighting for the case.
customer_reviews.author: Raul

customer_reviews.title: I love this case!
customer_reviews.text: This case is so perfect I’m so glad I picked it for my build. It feels very sturdy and is all metal and glass except the front plastic panel that comes off. The wire management is great and the case is spacious and looks really sharp. It comes with an LED light strip that lights up the inside and you can change the colors. Highly recommend this case it has a sweet glass panel along the entire side so you can see all your parts. It can even fit a noctua DH15 but I could only fit one of the fans because the ram and back case fan got in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Olds

customer_reviews.title: Stunning, but lacking solid airflow.
customer_reviews.text: this case looks amazing, nice job Phanteks. My only problem with this case is that there is not very good airflow for the front of the case. I have to mount my cpu cooler there, as many other will, and the air flow is clearly lacking for that part of the case. Maybe on the next version that can improve that just a bit. Overall though building in the case was easy, cable management was amazing, and it looks absolutely stunning.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Fiorellini

customer_reviews.title: Great case to build in
customer_reviews.text: Great case to build in, I love the simplicity, the power supply shroud is awesome too. I picked this over the S340 Elite for a few reasons, including: better airflow, more filters, included RGB strip with Aura support (I do not want anything to do with CAM), and lastly, the Phanteks name. I really enjoy the air cooler I purchased from them in 2013. It has great performance, superior build quality and great aesthetics.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon G

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Case w/ Space
customer_reviews.text: Love this case. Previous case was NZXT and i am really torn with which i like better. Love the design and the option to put a 360mm fan in the front. Problem with that is you won't have any space for 3.5" hard drives. Really great case. Love the RGB options and the openness of it. Great for my mATX board.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Shaver

customer_reviews.title: Nice Job.
customer_reviews.text: Great case! Love the feel and quality of it. So much room to work with. Though you get all that room because there is not a disk drive bay and the HDD bay is under the PSU cover. If you want it to sync with your ASUS AURA equipment, get the RGB LED 4 Pin Adapter, you will need it! It's cheap enough. Though I wish there was more head room for a radiator. All I could fit up top was a fan and it barely doesn't touch the MOBO.
customer_reviews.author: Hotlog

customer_reviews.title: ... is white and honestly it does not look very good with the white
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this case to be all black but the shield for the power supply along with some trim on the very top of the outside is white and honestly it does not look very good with the white. The tempered glass looks really awesome and it really shows off the hardware nicely. It also offers some good cable management but the lack of the option to do a DVD drive and not enough places to mount hard drives makes it not as good as I would like.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I love this case, works perfectly and has a lot of ventilation. Never have issues with temps and came with LED lights which are an awesome pairing with the glass side. Easy to take off the glass side to clean the inside of the cpu as well.
customer_reviews.author: Vikash Singh

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant case, great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Convenient, simple and easy. Gorgeous side panel and stylish PSU shroud make it easy to show off components. Wire harnesses and velcro straps throughout are also a plus. Plenty of room to mount fans and a water cooler. Would buy again and have recommended to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Golon

customer_reviews.title: This is a really nice case. I bought it for my son and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice case. I bought it for my son and we built his computer a couple of weeks ago. Really easy to work with, I love that it has slots for the Radiator/Fan Mount in the front. Black Cables fro case connects bit I will say I was a bit annoyed I could see some of the individual colored wires as they went to the connectors as well as the USB 3.0 header was blue. A little black tape though and all was well. Really good cable management system with a few cable ties thrown in. It also came with an LED strip with a generous lead cable. Top notch!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Case
customer_reviews.text: While this isn't quite a 'budget' case you get a lot of bang for your buck with this product. It feels like a very premium product considering the price: with a tempered glass side panel, solid cable routing options, LED intergration (a free strip is included to match the one featured on the front panel), four drive bays (two 2 1/2 and two 3 1/2), and a power supply to shroud to hide all the ugly extra cabling. All this is a perfectly sized form factor, you'll find very little little in terms of wasted space in this case. Great for first-time builders and PC veterans alike.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: pog
customer_reviews.text: case is pog only comes with 2 drive bays for regular hdds, but comes with 4 more slots for expansions to increase your hdd count. there are only 2 ssd bays on the backside of the motherboard. The RGB wiring is difficult to understand but once you find out what cables do what and go where it gets simple fast.
customer_reviews.author: JonJon

customer_reviews.title: Best case purchase in 10+ years...
customer_reviews.text: One of the best case purchases I've made in a long time. Interior is easy to run wires for a clean setup, and the multi-configuration of the LED lights are nicely controlled from the front panel (something I had somehow missed in the reviews/description). No complains with this case so far - even the default case fans are super quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of space for even the largest of video cards.
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the 20th Phantek case I've ordered. Never have I been disappointed. I build these for clients that appreciate style, lights and cooling efficiency. This is well put together, has great cable management, SSD mounts and a clean RGB strip.
customer_reviews.author: RobM

customer_reviews.title: Nice case. Instructions are hidden. Use common sense.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this case for its durability and looks. The only thing I was not found of was that the directions were in the HHD slot. Meaning if you don’t figure out that the back cover slides towards the back and you don’t pull it outwards, you may struggle for a minute. Try not to bend the case lol. It’s very nice though. Back cover slides back. Duh.
customer_reviews.author: april springett

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price and beginning pc builders!
customer_reviews.text: The case is meant for beginning PC builders who are looking for an AMAZING budget pc case. For the price, it comes with many great features such as the rgb led strip on the bottom front of the case which is color synchronized with the power button's led as well. The tempered glass is the same that you find even on more expensive pc cases!
customer_reviews.author: Aldo Lopez

customer_reviews.title: It’s a good looking PC case
customer_reviews.text: I really like this case. It’s sleek and makes my set up stand out. Only downfall to this case is you need to be careful about scratches as it’s a white case and scratches may be visible. But if you’re careful. It’s a great case.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Espino

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for $$
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this new case. Easy cable management, ample room, magnetic dust covers, good airflow, great bang for your $$. MSI X470 Ryzen 5 2600x OC'd to 4.2Ghz Team Group 16Gb ram OC'd to 3200 EVGA GTX 1080 SC2 w/ KBoost at 2000Mhz Phanteks P400 Thermaltake Riing 12 x3 Corsair H60 with 2 x 120mm fans in push/pull config Phanteks 120mm x 2 for front intake
customer_reviews.author: MudBug

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice case to build in. Excellent build quality and cable management features. The only thing that keeps this case from five stars is the air flow is choked by the very small slots at the top and bottom of the front panel. Modifying the front panel by cutting a hole and covering it with the provided magnetic filter improved temperatures significantly. I love the case now and it's also beautiful to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Case
customer_reviews.text: Completed my first build after choosing the Phanteks case and I'm pleased to report that this is an incredible value. The materials are excellent and the layout makes installing components a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: SmokeShowing

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING BIG BANG FOR YOUR BUCK!!!!! BETTER THAN A $120 CASE
customer_reviews.text: This case is beautiful glass window came unbroken and the case is honestly a big bang for your bug for budget builders I honestly love this case I had a corsair air 240 and it was trash compared to the build quality and overall performance and the corsair case costed way more than this one i love this case
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Y.

customer_reviews.title: Great case
customer_reviews.text: A great all around case, i just wish it had some more storage space. I have 2 HDDs and 2 SSDs installed and thats the most it can fit, at least to my knowledge. Other than that its a great case with a tempered glass window & rgb. 9.5/10
customer_reviews.author: Qudsia Alimi

customer_reviews.title: Bad power switch out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Bad power switch out of the box costed hours of extra troubleshooting during new PC build. I saw another review with same issue. Nice looking case and good design but do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Best Case for Price
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best case I have ever built in. Very good price and is super roomy. It can fit full size gpus and even over sized ones. One downside is that it only has 2 3.5 drive bays. The RGB is great same with the tempered glass. Cable management is super easy. Good job Phanteks!
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Back fan came Defective.
customer_reviews.text: The back case fan came defective. When I plug it in, it kind of jerks, but does not spin. I bought a few case fans on amazon in addition to replace the one and add more, but over all kind of a buzz kill to a good case.
customer_reviews.author: Lex

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, very roomy, airflow is a little poor
customer_reviews.text: The case is good except for the airflow. It was getting relatively warm inside, so i cut two holes out of the front panel and stuck some fan filters on there to pull extra air through and it helps.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: This case is sick
customer_reviews.text: This case has a nice glass cover on the side so you can see the internals of the computer. There are LED lights all over the case and it even comes with a magnetic light strip you can add anywhere. There are around 12 different settings for the LED which all have their own unique color profile. What I didn't like about this is that you couldn't control the LEDs with your PC, but it definitely is not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Aranda

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: All around great case and value. The PSU enclosure really cleans up the look and eases cable management. The led strips create a great ambience, and the tempered glass is nice and hefty. Overall, a great case for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Top of the Line for Gaming
customer_reviews.text: This is a well constructed Tower. I enjoyed helping my son build his gaming system. Cable management is Awesome. The only thing I had trouble with was determining + & - for the front panel connections.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case!
customer_reviews.text: This case is perfect, for a medium ATX is very spacious, great material, perfect cable management, great ventilation, what else can you ask for the price. Totally recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Abreu

customer_reviews.title: Nice case, and Excellent Price
customer_reviews.text: This case has plenty of cable management, and is modular enough for my needs. Excellent air flow in the case aswelll; dropped my CPU temps by 8 C just buy putting it in this case. Ended up butchering the PSU/HDD cover in the bottom so I could run an eight pin to my CPU, but that's because I'm far to lazy/cheap to get a longer cable for my PSU. PS: I rarely give 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Needs better air flow
customer_reviews.text: Case was easy to assemble my pc into and has a great look and integrated Led lights. The big problem with it though is the temps. I feel that they need to include at least one more intake fan on the front of the case. Before buying and installing more case fans I was getting idle temps of 55 degrees Celsius
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Belcher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent except for the front
customer_reviews.text: Fun and easy to build in, also nice that it includes an RGB strip. Only thing that holds this case back is the front intake slits on the top and bottom which are not enough to keep the interior temp of the pc cool. I had a change in gpu temp by 5C compared to old case with an open front.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Pig

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Quiet
customer_reviews.text: I really like this case, if you are looking for the best airflow however, this case is not for you. This case is more for people who want a nice and quiet case.
customer_reviews.author: Frost_Tech

customer_reviews.title: Great compact mid tower that somehow is big enough to be my plex server and my SIM rig!
customer_reviews.text: Not the biggest of enclosures, but somehow it finds the space to have eight hard drives, a large PSU and a full size GPU. Cable management is great, although a little cramped when closing the back cover. The included LED strips are a great bonus that I was not expecting!
customer_reviews.author: Mikael Bertani

customer_reviews.title: Good case
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my best friends first build and it worked out great! Easy to put together and really clean design. He loves it. Unfortunately, I don't have a photo of his build, but it looked great!
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir Dasic

customer_reviews.title: Very Solid Foundation !!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Case! Looks great. Very well built with a very nice, clear glass panel. Plenty of room for all your hookups, cables and hardware to be tucked away for a nice Professional look. Overall a Great Tower for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamen G.

customer_reviews.title: 101% recommended
customer_reviews.text: One of the best the only thing is in my case my Asus Rog Hero X WiFi the back fan hide one of the logo rgb motherboard but it’s a very VERY nice and beautiful case
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Awesome case- looks great
customer_reviews.text: Love this case- my boyfriend built a custom computer for me and this case was perfect for what we were looking to accomplish. Allowed us to hide a lot of cords and end up with a clean look
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Cavalleri

customer_reviews.title: LED lights dont work
customer_reviews.text: This case looks fantastic, and everything seems to be good quality.. but after assembling everything, it appears that the led lighting doesn't work. The big strip that came with it is functional when the power was tested, so I dont know if it's a faulty chip or faulty wire or something. I'm a little frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: James E Jackson

customer_reviews.title: great case for the price
customer_reviews.text: great case for the price. better then most at this price point and some at higher price points! the case has a nice tempered glass window that's slightly tinted, included rgb led strip and good cable management options... I would def recommend this case, especially if your on a budget
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Nice Case, Glass does not seal
customer_reviews.text: Very clean/modern looking case. Easy to assemble my setup. My only con is, the tempered glass does not seal tightly (maybe because one of the seals is missing for the screws), so having all these dust filters makes it pointless as it is already getting dusty in there. There were some other cases in similar price, but this one had quite a few reviews so I went with it.
customer_reviews.author: APG

customer_reviews.title: Rgb & Tempered glass without the huge price.
customer_reviews.text: Great case. You get the tempered glass side panel, and built in rgb controller without the huge price. Cable management is a+. The case has straps to tidy up the cables in the back side. The only issue I had with the case was radiator clearance on the top fan mounts.
customer_reviews.author: Leeskiie

customer_reviews.title: Beauty Over Brains
customer_reviews.text: This case is gorgeous, but be warned- she's dumb. There is no place to install a 5.25" optical drive. If you have to have one, you'll need an external one. (I have never thought to check if a case has a slot for an optical drive before). Also, the drive cage has room for only 2 hard drives (and 2 SSDs), so if you're doing a RAID setup, this may not be the case for you. Missing features aside, the case is extremely well made, everything is top quality with a nice cable management system behind the right cover. It's so pretty, I kept it, and jury rigged a third drive mount between the PSU and the drive cage.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a tempered glass case so this was a first but wow. I picked this case to match my other components and it looks amazing. The build was extremely easy and the led strips it comes with are fantastic. I had the Apevia X Harmony before this and I wish I had spent the extra $10 at the time. Great quality and a wonderful build.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: After having this for 3 years the quality is still there. Phanteks did an awesome job with cable management and the placement of SSD slots. 10/10 would refer this product to anyone who is looking to build a sleek and killer rig.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Deal, stunning case.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely Beautiful. The case uses so many clever little tricks that make everything super user friendly, it has 2 included 120 mm fans, included case lighting, full metal body, and a freaking tempered glass side panel! for like 90 bucks! This case is absolutely amazing for it's price. I just moved to this from a Corsair 750D because i needed to downsize, and god am i incredibly happy that i did. Beautiful case. If you're looking for mid-size and Tempered glass, just buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Peyvian

customer_reviews.title: It looks great and has infinitely better cable management than my old ...
customer_reviews.text: This case is less of a matte battleship grey and more of a gunmetal grey. It looks great and has infinitely better cable management than my old Antec 300. The tempered glass is beautiful and fits well. Do yourself a favor and get a fan hub to hook everything into on the back side of the case to clean up some more cables.
customer_reviews.author: Vash

customer_reviews.title: A great budget case!
customer_reviews.text: Fits a lot of things in it. I wish the front panel had better airflow though. Other than that, it is a great case.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Perfection on a budget.
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, plenty of cable tie locations and ample cable management space behind the solid panel. Haven't been able to finish the build yet because parts are still shipping but will definitely be posting a picture here once finished. The mild tint on the glass is a great touch, and the pre-installed dust screens were a phenomenal addition as my house can be quite dusty. For the price and seeing it in person I couldn't be happier. This product is easily a steal. A+ Phanteks.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Clean case, fair price
customer_reviews.text: Great case, could use a little more air flow coming in the front for my build set up but for the price range never the less a great case. The cable management was a dream thanks to several well placed cutouts and built in cable management straps / grooves
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: I got this case for $60 plus tax way better than my micro ATX case
customer_reviews.text: I got this case for $60 plus tax way better than my micro ATX case. This is a good case for your 1st or even 2nd PC builds just the right enough amount of space, easy on the wallet, LED, tampered glass and goo wire management tools built in the case I couldn't ask for more can't wait to upgrade my rig with this case
customer_reviews.author: Sean Eric Tecson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing case for a decent price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case because as much as I love the look of the Enthoo Evolv Tempered Glass, I didn't want the tempered glass panel and the back side exposing all of my cables, and because I didn't like the price of the Enthoo Evolv. I am not disappointed. I was able to pick this thing up for $80 with free Prime shipping. Pretty good deal if you ask me, and it looks amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Great case for first build
customer_reviews.text: Great case with fairly good cable management. Glass side panel is easy to remove, which makes it an easy case to clean dust out of. Does not have a slot for a CD/DVD drive, but most people won't find this an issue. If you need one, just buy an external drive.
customer_reviews.author: nms5419

customer_reviews.title: this case is awesome! It was my first time building my own ...
customer_reviews.text: this case is awesome ! It was my first time building my own computer and the case was very easy to put everything together. Love the glass view.
customer_reviews.author: Weekend Warrior

customer_reviews.title: Good case overall but has restrictive airflow problems.
customer_reviews.text: Good build quality and easy to install, however my biggest issue with this case is the restricted airflow from the front. I ended up having to cut a large hole in the front panel to improve my airflow as before my gpu temp was in the 70c-80c range under load. After cutting out a large hole in the front it made my temps drop to 65c-70c under load.
customer_reviews.author: john zhang

customer_reviews.title: Not bad just not great
customer_reviews.text: Case is decent. Power supply placement not a fan of for cable routing reach to top of board.
customer_reviews.author: JW Ideas

customer_reviews.title: No regrets after two years
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic case. I bought this for my PC build almost two years ago, and its really a great case, possibly the best one available at this price point. Premium materials and extremely easy to build in and manage cables. The LED lighting is a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Joy B.

customer_reviews.title: Sexiest case ever
customer_reviews.text: IT CAME WITH A LED STRIP!! I DIDN'T KNOW!! I am so satisfied with the case. The filters work great; the office room gets dusty quick and the case doesn't let the dust get in (of course it gets but very minimal for months!). Though, the cable management side IS VERY DUSTY, so remember to clean that side while you may not need to clean the window side.
customer_reviews.author: Ulises

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Inexpensive Case!
customer_reviews.text: It is perfect with black and white theme I wanted for my build! Would recommend if you are into minimalistic appearance when it comes to your pc!
customer_reviews.author: Luis Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: This case is well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The cable management is great, the look is great, and everthing fits fine! The led color strip is changeable via a button by the power button. The only thing I would recommend is buying extra case fans, it only comes with 2, I added one extra fan and changed the fan layout and my temps are nice and cool.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Why no top vent cover??
customer_reviews.text: Great case, but I wish they would still include the cover for the top vent with the non-silent Sku. I am fine with the lack of sound dampening, but if I don't want to use the top vent (because there is no clearance for a RAD) I am stuck with a large opening for every bit of noise to escape.
customer_reviews.author: Nuthinbuthetruth

customer_reviews.title: Good value, decent airflow, and bad water cooling support.
customer_reviews.text: Good layout and value. I probably would have sprung for the p400s instead for the dampening looking back at it. The tempered glass is very nice and the cable routing is generally sufficient. However the airflow is okay at best and there's just no possible way to do a top mounted radiator. Even slim rads will be hitting your motherboard after you install some fans. Good value overall though.
customer_reviews.author: swarley

customer_reviews.title: Aesthetically the case is amazing! However there are a few differences between this ...
customer_reviews.text: Aesthetically the case is amazing! However there are a few differences between this one and the p400s, most notably is the fan controller hub, and the lack of additional dust filters/ vent covers. Also while the case looks amazing, the airflow is a bit restrictive. Popping off the front cover helps nullify this issue but it doesn't look as nice, all in all its a great case still and for the price it's pretty hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Andrew Saldana

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and plenty of room
customer_reviews.text: I just built a PC in the case today and it looks nice. The included rgb strip is nice and the glass side panel lets everyone see your beautiful build. The only complaint I have is how hard it was to get things in and out of the HDD slots.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Love The Glass
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this from a H440. The tempered glass is amazing along with the ability to front mount a dual radiator. Just note that the glass is slighted tinted but the free magnetic led strip it comes with will brighten up the inside for you.
customer_reviews.author: DareDevil

customer_reviews.title: Awesome case!!! Cable management perfection
customer_reviews.text: I’m somewhat new to building PC’s I wanted a good looking case that would keep my build Cole and look good. phanteks made an amazing simple install process. I used a B350M from MSI which left some room on the bottom but looks great super happy overall
customer_reviews.author: OriginaldoBo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing so far
customer_reviews.text: Love it so far. Some of the wires aren’t clearly visible and have to be searched for but overall was easy to setup. Clean and looks amazing. No issues, I just wish I opened up some of the panels for wiring to go through before finishing my build up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glass is easy to remove just hand twist the screws everything else is a hit or miss
customer_reviews.text: This case is apart of my first PC build and I found it annoying that my accessories box is placed in an odd location to get to. (Have to unscrew a bunch of screws to open the panel) shown in photo. From every review video I have watched it has been easily accessible out in the open . There has been many delays I’ve encountered in building my rig but now I’m checking to see if this case is missing any parts. Overall I’m satisfied with this product even though there was this minor hiccup.
customer_reviews.author: DJjmic

customer_reviews.title: More features than most $80 cases!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect case to show off my new Ryzen build! For $79 you can't go wrong. I've never seen so many features packed into a case at this price point. Plenty of cable routing options to make your build look clean!. Super easy to build in as well. A nice touch are the SSD mounts on the back of the motherboard tray. It also comes included with a magnetic LED strip, and a magnetic dust filter on top. I don't know if there is enough I can say about this case. If you are looking to do a new build, or trying to breath some life into an old system, go ahead get this case, you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Jared Erickson

customer_reviews.title: best case ever for the money, great build, very sturdy great options all around.
customer_reviews.text: One if the nicest made cases i have ever worked on. wire maintenance was a breeze tons of options for fans and radiators. my setup looks so sweet with this case and the included light strip was just the icing on the cake.
customer_reviews.author: N P

product_meta.title: Phanteks PH-EC416PTG_BK Eclipse P400 Steel ATX Mid Tower Case Satin Black, Tempered Glass Edition Cases
product_meta.description: Color:BlackPhantoms' budget-friendly Eclipse P400 now sports an all new tempered glass side panel. The new variant of the Eclipse Series still features the solid build quality, built-in RGB lighting controller, open interior design, compatibility with all-in-one liquid cooling. The Eclipse P400 tempered glass panel adds to its distinct beauty and brings an additional bit of ﬂair and sophistication to your system build.
feature_bullets: Full Metal Body, Steel Exterior and Tempered Glass Side Panel. Clean interior –PSU Cover & HDDs. 10 color RGB downlight + RGB power light with on/off switch. 300mm RGB LED strip included
Fully Equipped with Magnetic Dust Filters. Innovative Modular HDD System (requires PH-HDDKT_02). 2x Drop-N-Lock SSD brackets included. Long GPU (supports up to 15.2in)
Full Size PSU support. Removable HDD cage for installation of long PSU's (>270mm)/water-pump.
Hidden Front I/O (2x USB 3.0, Headphone, Mic, LED Control, Reset). Clean cable management using Phanteks' preinstalled Hoop-N-Loop cable ties.
Optimal airflow - Direct airflow to CPU/GPU. 1x Phanteks 120mm Fan in front. 1x Phanteks 120mm Fan in rear. Supports water-cooling radiators (up to 360).

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars893 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
